abstract: Population of prairie chickens, type of small grouse, has plummeted over several decades in Texas, with only 104 birds remaining in 2015 despite strong effort to breed them in captivity; scientists fear species may not survive, pointing to difficulty of recovery after numbers have dropped dangerously low.
lead_paragraph: Despite a vigorous breeding program, the population of Attwater’s prairie chickens has dwindled. Conservationists say the species may not survive.

headline.main: The Fight to Save a Prairie Chicken

snippet: Despite a vigorous breeding program, the population of Attwater’s prairie chickens has dwindled. Conservationists say the species may not survive.

keywords.value: Attwater Prairie Chicken National Wildlife Refuge (Texas)
